$interpreted: Old Professor: Thus, all one need do is start this device, which *cough* I made with my own hands, and one can extract and control the Crystal's energy...
Old Professor: This is a true energy revolution! A cross-generational invention right before your very eyes!
Novice Assistant: Professor, this machine looks pretty unstable...
Old Professor: Behold the power!
Old Professor: *cough*...I don't hear any applause.
Old Professor: Is that...a screw?
Novice Assistant: Pro...professor!
Old Professor: This is it! Feast your eyes! All this energy...
Novice Assistant: Professor! Are you alright?
Old Professor: This... this is true... cross-generational research...
Novice Assistant: Ahhhhhhhh!
Morris: Don't move.
Morris: Stand up, monkey.
Novice Assistant: Thank heavens... we're saved! Thank you...
Morris: Don't thank God, thank me.
Morris: Nothing good can be said about this useless piece of junk.
Morris: Truly a disaster... just disappear, won't you?
Morris: Ah, researching Crystal energy...
Morris: ...what a waste of resources. I can use this.
Charle: What happened?
Morris: Hello, Ceres.
Charle: I just heard there was an issue at the conference...
Morris: Sorry, but you're a little late. You missed quite the show.
Charle: Show?
Morris: You really want to know?  This dog and pony show Applied Magic scholars take for a conference. Just look at that flaming pile of trash.
Charle: ...the activating Rune isn't stable enough. Not to mention the structure and material of the device are both completely off.
Charle: No wonder it was unable to control the mineral's energy.
Morris: Relying on particular substances and not uncovering the internal potential; these are the limits of Applied Magic.
Charle: Dietrich, instead of mocking me, we should be...
Morris: ...helping the injured? Cut the crap. I could do this all by myself with my eyes closed.
Morris: How's that, Ceres? At the conference in a few days time, I'll present plenty of research on my own. Don't forget your notebook..
Charle: Quite a complicated formula...No wonder the Crystals can be used to amplify healing Runes.
Morris: It doesn't last long enough, but more or less does the trick.
Charle: However, the formula itself is way too abstruse. Only a very limited number of people will be able use it.
Morris: Wrong, only me. This formula was made for me and only me.
Morris: Not only is it innovative, but it's also completely original.
Charle: ...Dietrich, in order to improve the lives of everybody, we ought to simplify the formula or find supplementary materials...
Morris: This empty talk is for you folks in Applied Magic to deal with. The Runes of a genius aren't meant to be given to dogs.
Charle: How can you say that? We used to be just like everybody else.
Charle: Using our research to benefit and improve the lives of the general public; is this not the obligation of a scholar?
Morris: How noble...so this is the lie you tell yourself, eh?
Charle: What...?
Morris: The way I see it, that's just an excuse. Just a group of sore losers, licking each other's wounds. How pathetic.
Charle: You...
Morris: The real truth is to be found within the depths of the ego. This is the core tenet of Life Magic.
Morris: ── Remember that well, Charle Ceres!!
Charle: Dietrich...could it be...that you really believe that you can uncover the truth all on your own?

Model.Text: Thus, all one need do is start this device, which *cough* I made with my own hands, and one can extract and control the Crystal's energy...
This is a true energy revolution! A cross-generational invention right before your very eyes!
Professor, this machine looks pretty unstable...
Behold the power!
*cough*...I don't hear any applause.
Is that...a screw?
Pro...professor!
This is it! Feast your eyes! All this energy...
Professor! Are you alright?
This... this is true... cross-generational research...
Ahhhhhhhh!
Don't move.
Stand up, monkey.
Thank heavens... we're saved! Thank you...
Don't thank God, thank me.
Nothing good can be said about this useless piece of junk.
Truly a disaster... just disappear, won't you?
Ah, researching Crystal energy...
...what a waste of resources. I can use this.

Hello, Ceres.
I just heard there was an issue at the conference...
Sorry, but you're a little late. You missed quite the show.

...the activating Rune isn't stable enough. Not to mention the structure and material of the device are both completely off.

...helping the injured? Cut the crap. I could do this all by myself with my eyes closed.

Quite a complicated formula...No wonder the Crystals can be used to amplify healing Runes.
It doesn't last long enough, but more or less does the trick.

Wrong, only me. This formula was made for me and only me.
Not only is it innovative, but it's also completely original.
...Dietrich, in order to improve the lives of everybody, we ought to simplify the formula or find supplementary materials...
This empty talk is for you folks in Applied Magic to deal with. The Runes of a genius aren't meant to be given to dogs.
How can you say that? We used to be just like everybody else.
Using our research to benefit and improve the lives of the general public; is this not the obligation of a scholar?
How noble...so this is the lie you tell yourself, eh?
What...?
The way I see it, that's just an excuse. Just a group of sore losers, licking each other's wounds. How pathetic.
You...
The real truth is to be found within the depths of the ego. This is the core tenet of Life Magic.
── Remember that well, Charle Ceres!!
Dietrich...could it be...that you really believe that you can uncover the truth all on your own?
